alert.note: Alert for Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 9:54AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Minnesota, including the following county, Lake. * WHEN...Until noon CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 944 AM CDT, Doppler radar estimated between 3 and 6 inches of rain fell Wednesday evening. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Runoff from this heavy rain will continue Thursday. - Little Isabella River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall is possible this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Isabella, southern Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks in the advised area. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
